summary: This is an email chain between attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP and federal prosecutors regarding a grand jury subpoena issued on July 5, 2019. The emails discuss scheduling meetings, sharing transcripts, and the prosecutors' mention of having contemporaneous telephone records showing the client had numerous phone contacts with underage girls.

persons.name: Suzanne Jaffe Bloom
persons.role: Partner at Winston & Strawn LLP, Defense Attorney
persons.context: Attorney representing a client who received a grand jury subpoena from the SDNY; she is coordinating meetings with prosecutors and confirming the adjournment of a grand jury appearance.

persons.name: Johanna Rae Hudgens
persons.role: Associate Attorney at Winston & Strawn LLP
persons.context: Associate attorney copied on the email chain, involved in scheduling meetings with prosecutors regarding the grand jury subpoena.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP working together on a case involving a grand jury subpoena.

events.title: SDNY Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was issued by the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Original Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The original date for a grand jury appearance as per the subpoena, which was adjourned.

events.title: Proposed Meeting Date
events.description: A proposed meeting date between defense attorneys and prosecutors to discuss the subpoena and related matters.

locations: 200 Park Avenue, New York, NY 10166-4193 (Winston & Strawn LLP office)
keyFacts: Prosecutors possess contemporaneous telephone records, including from a cell phone registered to the attorney's client, showing numerous phone contacts with multiple underage girls.
The grand jury subpoena was issued on July 5, 2019, and the initial appearance date of July 24, 2019, was adjourned.
The email chain involves discussions about a potential voluntary interview and sharing of court transcripts from related civil cases.
The client's identity is not explicitly named in the provided text but is the subject of the subpoena and investigation.
